title: For Sale/Trade:  Romanian Intrac MKII AK-74
postcontent:
Hello everyone I am listing my Romanian Intrac MK II AK-74 chambered in 5.45x39. I have owned this gun for a few years now and have fired it 3 times. Other than that it has sat in a soft case inside of a a safe.

The rifle is in the complete original East German Bakelite furniture from when it was sent over, to retain value and rarity. These were only imported for one year and one of the first Romanian AK-74's sent over. They were made from 100% military parts, turned into a semi-auto, and issued to the Romanian National Guard. A true military grade Ak-74.

Chrome lined barrel
Upswept charging handle
Original Bakelite Furniture
Threaded barrel
Non welded muzzle break
(Alot were welded on when sent over)
Side mount for scope
Four 10 Rd Vepr made mags
Two 30 Rd Bakelite mags
Soft carry case included

Fires flawlessly, Extremely accurate, Rifling is in pristine condition as well.

Do a little bit of research on these rifles if you are interested, they are extremely rare and highly sought after. I paid $1000 for the rifle, $160 for the magazines, and $300 for the scope. I would accept $1400 for everything. $1200 for the rifle and magazines. $1100 for the rifle and no magazines.

Thanks for your time and interests, I am in no position to be forced to sell the rifle, just curious as to see what offers are out there.

title: For Sale:  Benelli Super Nova Tactical
postcontent:
Benelli’s SuperNova Tactical embodies a modular design concept in a 12-gauge pump-action shotgun sight. At the heart of this new pump gun is a lightweight steel skeleton framework over-molded with a high-tech polymer, making the SuperNova Tactical super-light, super-strong and almost completely impervious to any weather condition. But the SuperNova Tactical isn’t just tough on the outside. Dual-action bars and a two-lug rotary bolt head that locks up steel to steel inside the barrel ensures that the SuperNova Tactical is rock solid to the core and capable of handling everything from light loads to 3-1/2" Magnums.

The SuperNova Tactical comes with either rifle sights or newly designed, military-style ghost-ring sights. The rear sight is click-adjustable for both windage and elevation. Optional three- tritium inserts can be easily installed. A magazine cut-off on the forearm allows for safe carry with a full magazine and empty chamber. Butt stock options include a tactical pistol grip stock, or the ComforTech® stock. The top of the SuperNova’s receiver is drilled and tapped to accommodate easy attachment of military-style optics.

You must be over 21 to own a Silencer. The NFA requires a one time per item *** $200.00 *** tax stamp on each Silencer, Short Barrel Rifle (SBR), .. basically any Class III item. The $200.00 Check or Money order is sent directly to the ATF with your Silencer paperwork. I handle all the paperwork for you. You just hand me the check to send in with the paperwork. Or if your not local I can send paperwork to you by mail. You only need sign a few spots in front of Notary and Drop in the mail with the $200 check made out to the ATF. To start paper work you pay for the Silencer and the Serial# that goes on the paperwork becomes yours. We can handle everything through the mail except the actual pickup of the Silencer. You will have to come to the shop or meet us at a gun show to take delivery after it clears the ATF.
So if the Silencer is $479.00 plus .06% county tax = $507.74.. you gotta pay an additional $200 directly to the ATF for the TAX stamp. title: For Sale:  Barrett 95
postcontent:
Fully loaded.

The Model 95 may weigh in at a smaller class, but packed into its lightweight bullpup design is the intense power of a .50 caliber magazine-fed weapon, the pinpoint accuracy of a bolt-action rifle and the effortless functionality of a perfectly designed machine.

This compact rifle offers the velocity and accuracy of a 29-inch barrel in a lightweight package with an overall length of just 45 inches. The Model 95 is made for those who refuse to sacrifice accuracy for power while allowing the shooter to quickly and accurately fire five rounds, reload with a fresh magazine and get back on target in seconds.

Its buttplate, magazine well and trigger housing are unitized, helping to stiffen the steel lower receiver. The steel upper receiver is reinforced with an M1913 rail and supports the chrome-chambered, fluted barrel. All Barrett rifles are designed for easy field stripping, so the two receivers can be assembled in less than 60 seconds without the use of tools.

The bolt carrier itself is a study in innovation designed for speed, reliability and safety. It slides effortlessly on machined-smooth rails, transporting a large bolt that locks into the barrel extension on three lugs. This bolt carrier assembly is a simplistic design with a quick release lever for fast disassembly. The firing pin is driven by dual springs designed for consistency and lightning-quick lock time.

Adopted by militaries all over the world, the Model 95 is not just proven in battle, it's also fun to shoot.

Comes with a Pelican Case

title: For Sale:  Glock 26 Gen 3 with case and extras!!!
postcontent:
Glock 26 | G26------> (AMMO IS NOT INCLUDED)
Size

The Glock 26 Gen 3 is classified as a sub-compact 9mm. At 6.49″ long, 4.17″ high and just 1.18″ thick, it’s pretty easy to conceal in a quality IWB holster while wearing shorts and a t-shirt. You sacrifice barrel length over the full sized models by about an inch, but this firearm proves to be just as accurate at respectable distances. And for it’s small size, it doesn’t pack too much of a punch as far as recoil goes. It is very manageable for follow-up shots.A side note on the size of this firearm: People have their own preferences with the size of the grip, as your pinky will be hanging down below the firearm with nothing to wrap around (unless you add a pinky extension plate on your magazine). I have no preference with this, as I shoot the same with or without the pinky extension.

Caliber

A great caliber in a small package. Everyone has their preferred caliber as well as their opinions regarding the usefulness of each caliber. For a close-range self defense firearm, it is my opinion that the 9mm round will get the job done if I am ever in that unfortunate situation. Choosing your carry ammunition is a whole other topic, but once the research is done, you will find that some 9mm rounds even outperform some 40 S&W and 45ACP rounds.

Simplicity

With simple items comes simple maintenance. Glocks are known for easy take-down. Now I’m not talking field strip here (although that’s super easy as well), I’m taking your full-blown take-everything-apart-one-piece-at-a-time-until-you-have-all-34-pieces-of-the-gun sitting in front of you (this includes the magazine). It’s so easy in fact, that I did it in roughly 4 minutes on my very first try, without directions.

Known as the "BABY GLOCK," the GLOCK 26 in 9x19mm has been the most sought-after concealed carry option since its release in 1994-a market once dominated by the 5-round snubnose revolver. The magazine capacity of 10 rounds is standard, and the highly accurate firing characteristics explain why the G26 is the mainstay backup option among security personnel and agencies worldwide.

title: For Sale:  Ruger SR9C
postcontent:
Selling my gun because I have my eyes set on another.  It's the gun on the bottom of the picture.

The SR9c compact pistol weighs in at 23.40 oz. and features an overall length of 6.85", a height of 4.61", and the same slim 1.27" grip width (across safety levers) as the full-sized SR9. It comes with two magazines that provide options in both capacity and grip size. The standard magazine holds 10 rounds and features a flat bottom butt plate; a finger grip extension floor plate is also included. The second magazine features a grip adapter and holds 17 rounds, instantly transforming the smaller, compact grip into a full-sized 9mm grip. The 3.50" barreled pistol features an integral accessory rail that accommodates most lights and lasers.

The SR9c compact pistol utilizes the same adjustable, high-visibility 3-Dot sight system as its full-sized predecessor, setting it apart from many compact pistols that rely on fixed sights. New serrations are located on the front portion of the slide, making it easier to both manipulate the slide and to press check the chamber. The SR9c is available with a glass-filled nylon frame and through-hardened slide in either a brushed stainless or black nitrite finish. State compliant variations are available where necessary and ship with two 10-round magazines.

Just like the original, full-sized SR9, the SR9c is loaded with modern safety features like a 1911-style ambidextrous manual safety, internal trigger bar interlock and striker blocker, trigger safety, magazine disconnect, plus a visual and tactile loaded chamber indicator.

http://www.ruger.com/products/sr9c/index.html?utm_source=GunReports

title: For Sale:  Kimber Warrior 45ACP 1911
postcontent: Kimber Warrior The new Kimber Warrior .45 ACP is a civilian version of the pistol Kimber created to outfit the elite Marine Detachment assigned to U.S. Special Operations Command. It seamlessly transitions into one of the finest, most powerful personal defense or law enforcement pistols ever offered to the public. Built for combat and featured accordingly Built for combat and featured accordingly, the Warrior .45 ACP is also one of the best Kimber pistols for duty carry or personal defense. It is tough, absolutely dependable and very accurate. Both slide and frame are machined from solid steel and wear matte black KimPro II, a non-refl ective finish that is self-lubricating and extremely resistant to wear, salt and the elements. The Warrior also has an extended ambidextrous thumb safety, plus a short (military length) guide rod for fast takedown. Kimber G-10 grip panels ensure a positive grip regardless of conditions, and a lanyard ring off ers additional retention options. Standard Kimber features like match grade barrel, chamber, trigger and barrel bushing ensure unequaled accuracy. Warrior pistols include a 7-round magazine with extended bumper for fast, positive loading, as well as an extended ambidextrous thumb safety that allows fast operation with either hand. The best pistol to carry is a 1911, and the best 1911 is a Kimber.

title: For Sale:  Rare Antique Colt Bisley Model SAA
postcontent: This is an extremely hard to find Colt Bisley Model Single Action Army with an antique range serial number (1898). This gun has what many shooters consider the best shooting barrel length, particularly for the Bisley. The caliber is .41 Colt which is much rarer than the .45, 44-40, 32-20, or the 38-40. The condition is as seen in the pictures. A lot of bright blue with other areas such as the left side of the barrel, backstrap, and part of the trigger guard blending with a nice untouched blue/brown patina. There are nice areas of case coloring, particularly on the front part of the frame, hammer sides, and inside the frame. The screws are perfect with much fire blue remaining. The action is excellent, with all four clicks sharp and clean and very little movement when in full cock. The bore is way above average for a black powder gun with strong rifling and a mostly bright bore with scattered light black powder pitting. The front sight has been lowered a little and filed to a sharper profile, undoubtedly for accuracy. This gun has been shot for serious effect!. Shipping will be a flat $35 and will be sent priority mail to your door as an antique.

title: For Sale:  Enfield/Savage .303 Brit US Property Lend Lease Rifle
postcontent:
A nice example of what I feel was the best rifle of WW2. The Enfield .303 is a great all-round set-up. This model is the #4 made by Savage in the good Ol' US of A for the Brits as a Lend/Lease before we got hot & heavy in the Great War. Dated 1942, Comes with detachable 10 round box mag, the barrel is bright and shiny with no corrosion and the lans/grooves look factory fresh, rifle has the peep/adjustable rear flip up sight to allegedly reach out to a thousand meters, full wood stock, front sight wings to protect the front blade, no missing parts. Comes with 56 rounds of WW2 ammo with a bunch of different head-stamps from England and other countries/factories as well. You can use the rounds but they are corrosive and as such the rifle would need to be washed down directly.
I first fired the rifle in 2011 and it was fine and using Remington core-lokts I put up very nice groupings at 100 yards. I have personally put 2 boxes (40rds) down-range and was nicely surprised by the accuracy of a Mil-Surplus classic.
There is an import mark on the bottom of the front of the barrel that reads CAI (Stupid as it's a US made rifle, but oh well), it is barely legible and could be buffed off or even painted over as half the Enfields were flat black paint. The gentlemen I bought the rifle from said he would buff it down but as I did not buy as a pinnacle piece for a collection, I wasn't worried about it.

There are many of these rifles out there for $400-$500 asking, but I feel the $300 firm is fair and as such there is no need for anyone to send low-ball offers as they will be ignored.
Selling to Oregon residents 18 or older willing to sign a Bill of Sale.
More pictures available upon request.
Thanks for looking!

title: For Sale:  Beretta 687 EL Gold Competition Set
postcontent:
Beretta 687 “EL” Competition Set

	This shotgun is truly a shooters dream gun. The craftsmanship by Beretta’s Gun Crafter’s is well defined in this “EL” engraving. The entire receiver is engulfed by the suburb engravers design highlighted in Gold. The right handed palm swell fits into the hand giving the natural perfect hand to trigger feel and enhances the notable balance of the gun in the hands. The checkering on the forearm and stock is more than up to the standards that’s expected by Beretta. From the Beretta competition logo butt pad to the white bead on the over and under barrels; the balanced swing of this gun; whether on the clay course’s or in the hunting field; was enhanced by all the custom work done to this fine firearm which created the overall shooters dream gun.  
	This Beretta EL Gold 12 Ga. shotgun was sent to Briley; one of the country’s most well renowned crafters of fine sub-gauge tube work. The gun has been completely tricked out by Briley to create the ultimate competition shooting gun package. What’s so nice about this package is it’s as close to being not only a skeet shooters dream but also has all that’s needed to make it the best it can be on the sporting clay course as well; so thus making it more than capable in the field for any hunter. 
	First, the package work consisted of the chamber work. They have been lengthened to allow for 3” shells desired by the sporting clay shooters who use them for those long shots. Back bored to reduce chamber pressures lowering shooter felt recoil for greater second shot acquisition. The barrel has Briley’s unique balanced/slotted porting; not only on the upper barrel but the lower barrel as well. So, no matter what barrel chosen to be shot first, the selective/ mechanical trigger will deliver and the balanced shot is the same from either barrel.
	Second, Briley fitted their entire new style Elite Sub-gauge tube package. The tubes are custom fitted to each barrel. They are color coated to designate its gauge size and which tube fits into the upper and lower barrel. The custom package consists of the entire sub-gauge set…20, 28, & 410. In addition, not only do the 12 Ga. barrels have removable custom designed chokes; the sub-gauge tubes have them as well. Though the trigger on this fine gun has the preferred mechanical trigger already, it was rechecked and set by Briley to be very crisp and assure the 410 re-set is dead on shot after shot.
	Third, the entire shotgun set is in-cased by Briley’s fine case. The case is custom designed for holding the entire gun and it’s components in black felt lined aluminum. It consists of specially designed slots for holding and protecting the entire set up with lockable latches. There are additional compartment for the tools, clean rods and extra choke tubes along with an additional allowance for adding an extra barrel, if/when desired. The slim lined designed case has unique outer-black rubber protection rings. In addition it sports their Briley Logo.

                                   Beretta 687“EL” Competition Set- Specs. 
Pre-Owned:
Gauge: 12
Style: Over & under…Competition Skeet and/or Sporting Clays 
Barrel: 28” Ported upper & lower…White front bead 
Chokes: Removable style…Extended or Flush
Stock: High grade walnut, Right hand Palm Swell, Checkered, Schnabel style forearm.
Trigger: Mechanical/Selective
Custom Work: By Briley
	          - Extended/back bored Chambers…3” shell capability
	          - Ported upper and lower barrels…Unique slotted style	
	          - Fitted New Elite style (matching numbered) Sub-Gage Tubes…20, 28, & 
                    410.
                   - All Sub-gauge tubes are the all desired removable choke style. 
                   - All tools provided, comes with two 12 Ga. Extended cylinder chokes that all 
                     sub-gauge tubes are fitted to and  two Extend SKT chokes & 2 flush 
                     chokes (1-SKT &1-IC). All sub-gauge tubes have four flush chokes each 
         	     (2-SKT; 1-IC; 1-MOD.)	
                     -Case: Fine Briley aluminum case…lockable…custom slotted 
                               compartments black-felt lined…additional compartments for 
                               cleaning rods and tools, additional slot for extra barrel capability…
                               Briley Logo.

Condition: All mechanical components are in excellent shooting condition (98%), the barrel to receiver lock up is very tight as it should be, parts are smooth pretty and shiny, no pitting.  The stock and forearm as well as the bluing show no notable shooter ware, no dings, dents or scratches (98%). The firearm’s over all condition shows it has been well kept. This is proven by the condition of the Briley Logo aluminum case on how the gun has been cared for. The fine case has unique black rubber protective rings, which adds to its eye catching slim line design.

This pistol has an adjustable over-travel trigger, drilled/tapped for barrel weights and for optical sight base. Front and back strap are stippled and duplicate the 1911 grip. Permit to purchase or carry required, and bill of sale will be written.
